radiographic_examinations.findings: cardiomegaly, a left upper-lobe opacity, and a small right lower-lobe opacity. Bilateral pleural effusions were noted with evidence of loculation on the left.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Less-prominent infiltrates were observed in chest radiographs from 25 February to 1 March, and a post-discharge chest radiograph revealed minimal residual bilateral pulmonary opacities in the right upper lobe.

radiographic_examinations.findings: large amount of mediastinal fluid accumulation extending from the great vessels to the heart, loculated left pleural effusion, and simple right pleural effusion.
bilateral pulmonary opacities with prominent ground glass appearance consistent with acute respiratory distress syndrome.
